description: CHANGE OF USE FROM RETAIL SHOP (CLASS A1) TO TAKEAWAY RESTAURANT (CLASS A3), INVOLVING SELF CONTAINMENT OF ACCOMMODATION ABOVE, INSTALLATION OF NEW SHOPFRONT AND INSTALLATION OF EXTRACT DUCT TO REAR.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates must be begun not later than the expiration of 5 years, beginning with the date of this permission.  Reason for condition: To comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

Condition : 2 - The Class A3 use hereby approved shall only operate between the hours of 08.00 am and 11.30 pm Monday to Saturday, and 09.00 am and 11.00 pm on any Sunday or on any Bank Holiday except Christmas Day or Good Friday without the prior consent in writing of the Local Planning Authority.  Reason for condition: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of adjoining residential properties.

Condition : 3 - The floors and walls between the ground floor premises and the proposed dwelling and adjacent dwellings shall be so adapted as to achieve a reasonable resistance to airbourne sound and, where relevant, impact sound as far as is practical having regard to the existing construction. The insulation shall be in accordance with a scheme previously submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of works.  Reason for condition: To ensure a satisfactory standard of residential amenity.

Condition : 4 - All plant and machinery shall be enclosed and soundproofed in accordance with a scheme to be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority and such sound insulation shall be permanently maintained thereafter.  Reason for condition: In order to protect the amenities of nearby residents.

Condition : 5 - Before the building is first used the measures for access for disabled persons shown on drawing no.05A, together with a flush threshold to the ground floor entrance, shall be implemented to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority and shall be permanently maintained thereafter.  Reason for condition: To ensure that there is adequate access to the building for disabled persons.

Condition : 6 - Details of the design, appearance and materials of any proposed roller shutter shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before its installation is commenced, and any such roller shutter shall be maintained thereafter to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority. Reason for condition: To protect the visual amenities of the area.

Condition : 7 - Details of the design, size, appearance and colour to be used for the external surfaces of the extract duct hereby approved shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any work is commenced, the duct shall be fixed to the building using anti-vibration mountings to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority and the duct and fixings shall be permanently maintained thereafter.  Reason for condition: To protect the visual amenities of the area and to safeguard the amenities of nearby residents.
Condition : 8 - Informative The Council is unlikely to grant approval for a solid shutter on grounds of security and amenity.
